author: krishnakumargupta
body: Hi All, We are connecting our windows machine from the centos 7.3 using WINRM and Negotiate authentication. To do this, below packages have installed on the centos 7.3 1)powershell-6.1.0.preview.1-1.rhel.7.x86_64.rpm 2)omi-1.4.2-1.x86_64 3)gssntlmssp-0.7.0-1.el7.x86_64 pwsh session hangs when i am running two sequential invoke-command. invoke-command -computername IP-credential domain\user-authentication Negotiate -scriptblock {$pwd} Give the password. and able to get pwd details. but next if i run the same steps. powershell hang and waiting for nothing. I have tried this behavior from powershell-6.0.0_beta.6-1.el7.x86_64.rpm to till powershell-6.1.0.preview.1-1.rhel.7.x86_64.rpm. This behavior introduced in powershell-6.0.0_rc-1.rhel.7.x86_64.rpm where is its working fine powershell-6.0.0_beta.9-1 build. Also I am facing second issue. Till beta 6.0.0_beta.9-1 build the responses were very fast from windows to linux and vice versa but after RC and till latest build of power shell, It taking much time to connect to the system. in terms of data, where Beta was taking 6-10 sec to connect to system, the latest build is taking 1-2 minutes to connect the system. from beta to RC. i am not seeing much about remoting commit apart from inclusion of psrp packages. P.S: Separate Install-PowerShellRemoting.ps1 from psrp.windows nuget package. Can anybody help me to understand more about the issue like why it got introduced in RC where as in beta its was working fine and taking less time. Steps to reproduce ------------------ Expected behavior ----------------- Powershell should not hang second time and should get current directory result. Actual behavior --------------- powershell session should not hang for indefinite time. Root cause: While doing the root cause analysis through wireshark, we observed that during first time, handshaking is happening proper way[windows box is able to connect from linux]. but while doing second time connection, linux system is waiting for response. Environment data ---------------- > $PSVersionTable PSVersion 6.1.0-preview.1 PSEdition Core GitCommitId v6.1.0-preview.1 OS Linux 3.10.0-693.21.1.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Mar 7 19:03:37 UTC 2018 Platform Unix PSCompatibleVersions {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...} PSRemotingProtocolVersion 2.3 SerializationVersion 1.1.0.1 WSManStackVersion 3.0

comments.author: MrHariSharma
comments.body:
I tried below command on CentOS 7.3 where PowerShell version is 6.2.3

$cred=Get-Credential
User=domain\Administrator
Invoke-Command -ComputerName Window2k19 -Credential $cred -Authentication Negotiate -ScriptBlock{return $pwd;}

It takes ~35 Seconds.

If I try same command with local Administrator then it is as good as it was with PowerShell 6.0.0 Beta.6 

$cred=Get-Credential
User=Administrator
Invoke-Command -ComputerName Window2k19 -Credential $cred -Authentication Negotiate -ScriptBlock{return $pwd;}

It takes ~1 Second.
Note: Computer Window2k19 is Windows 2019 machine and domain controller is created on Windows 2008 R2 machine.

comments.author: MrHariSharma
comments.body:
I tried the same issue on below environment:
Environment details:

Domain Server (Windows 2019)
Windows Server (Windows 2019)
Centos 7.3
Remote PowerShell execution from Centos to Windows Server 2019 Machine.
$cred=Get-Credential
User=domain\Administrator
Invoke-Command -ComputerName Window2k19 -Credential $cred -Authentication Negotiate -ScriptBlock{return $pwd;}

It takes ~39 Seconds.
Can someone please help? 

**I feel it is more related to Negotiate Authentication scheme. In wireshark logs (NTLMSSP_AUTH does not use Domain name), in PowerShell behavior is different for different version.

PowerShell 6.0.0 Beta 6 - In any case username passed without domain name, so user is treated like local admin
PowerShell 6.2.3 RC - PS provides as it is username, it does not remove domain user name** . In this case Negotiate Auth uses 1st Kerberos then NTLM which consume most of the time.

comments.author: tpaoletto
comments.body:
Same, indentical situation in our docker container:
OS: dockerized Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS
PS: 7.0.3

`Invoke-Command -ComputerName xxx -Credential $credentials -Authentication Negotiate -ScriptBlock \{ Get-PSDrive C } `

Invoke-Command hangs forever.
We saw that on the container we have an open socket but with no data returned from the remote host.
On the remote side there is a wsmprovhost.exe process spawned, but with no activity at all.

Is there any workaround ( like -IdleTimeout in the pssession) ?

@rishnakumargupta could you please also change the description of this issue? The real problem is not related to multiple invoke-command runs, but is more complex and wide on investigations.

title: Pwsh session hang when two sequential invoke-command is running.
